bestBHT.bht: At his own expense, this Roman centurion displayed his love for the Jews by building a synagogue. His gesture embodied reverence for God and zeal for the Law, uncommon for a Gentile. Recognizing his sincere affection for their nation, the Jewish elders sought Jesus' help on his behalf. The centurion's act of building the synagogue not only demonstrated practical love for the Jews but also served as a means to break through prejudice and foster reconciliation between Gentiles and Jews.

Sometimes a single person built a synagogue at his own expense, and gave it to the citizens; of which the Jews say, 'if a man builds an house, and afterwards devotes it to a synagogue, it is as a synagogue.'

bhtAttempts.bht: At his own expense, this Roman centurion demonstrated his love for the Jews by building a synagogue for them. His act of kindness was rooted in his reverence for God and zeal for the Law. This gesture, which was uncommon for a Gentile, showed his rare affection and disposition towards the Jews, potentially fueled by his eventual conversion to their religion. Recognizing the centurion's genuine love for their nation, the Jewish elders presented his request for his servant's healing to Jesus, understanding that his favor with the Lord was evident. This act of building the synagogue not only displayed the centurion's practical love for the Jews but also served as a point of reconciliation, breaking through the prejudice and enmity between the Gentiles and the Jews.

The Roman centurion's devoted love for the Jews manifested in his gesture of building a synagogue at his own expense. His action demonstrated his reverence for God and zeal for the Law. This uncommon act of affection and goodwill toward the Jews, possibly due to his conversion to their religion, prompted the Jewish elders to present his plea to Jesus, recognizing his special relationship with Him. By building the synagogue, the centurion not only exhibited practical love for the Jews but also helped mend the rift between Gentiles and Jews, overcoming prejudiced barriers.

The Roman centurion showed his deep love for the Jews by building a synagogue at his own expense. This act demonstrated his reverence for God and zeal for the Law. His uncommon affection for the Jews, possibly due to his conversion, led the Jewish elders to appeal to Jesus on his behalf. The centurion's gesture not only displayed practical love but also helped bridge the divide between Gentiles and Jews, breaking through prejudice and fostering reconciliation.

This Roman centurion exemplified his love for the Jews by building a synagogue himself, demonstrating his reverence for God and affinity for the Law. This uncommon act of goodwill towards the Jews, potentially as a result of his conversion, prompted the Jewish elders to approach Jesus on his behalf. The centurion's construction of the synagogue not only showcased his practical affection but also served to bridge the divide between Gentiles and Jews, dismantling prejudice and fostering reconciliation.

Recognizing his sincere affection for their nation, the Jewish elders sought Jesus' help on his behalf. The centurion's act of building the synagogue not only demonstrated practical love for the Jews but also served as a means to break through prejudice and foster reconciliation between Gentiles and Jews.
